page.title: 19TRANSPORT
page.content: Our D block has one main road, the A305l, which passes through Curdridge on its way to Park Gate from Botley. Two secondary roads through Tapnage and Biddenfield provide a good route to Wickham and access to the M27 is nearby. Most people in the area have cars and some have two or more. Many have boats for use on the River Hamble or in the Solent. The Bus Service is frequent and reliable. The Bus stops are Shedfield crossroads and Burridge Stores. Buses travel to Fareham, Winchester and Southampton. The nearest railway stations are Curdridge, Swanmore and Fareham. There are trains about once an hour.
